name: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation
summary: The Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation (Freddie Mac) is a publicly traded, government-sponsored enterprise that provides liquidity, stability, and affordability to the U.S. housing market by purchasing mortgages from lenders and packaging them into mortgage-backed securities. Headquartered in Tysons, Virginia, Freddie Mac plays a critical role in the secondary mortgage market and is under the conservatorship of the Federal Housing Finance Agency.
